com.latencybusters.lbmct

Class LbmCtRcv

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtRcv

  • public class LbmCtRcv
extends java.lang.Object
    A connected receiver. Maintains an underlying UM receiver. When an LbmCtRcv is created, its full initialization is deferred until its start(com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCt, java.lang.String, com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMReceiverAttributes, com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMReceiverCallback, com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtRcvConnCreateCallback, com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtRcvConnDeleteCallback, java.lang.Object) method is called.

    • Constructor Summary

      LbmCtRcv()
      Creates a Connected Topic Receiver object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LbmCtRcv

        public LbmCtRcv()
        Creates a Connected Topic Receiver object. Creation of a CT Receiver object creates an underlying UM Receiver. Unlike a UM receiver, creation of a CT Receiver object is not a two step process. (A UM receiver requires first looking up a UM topic object, and then creating the receiver. A CT receiver combines the two steps in its start(com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCt, java.lang.String, com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMReceiverAttributes, com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMReceiverCallback, com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtRcvConnCreateCallback, com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtRcvConnDeleteCallback, java.lang.Object) method.)

        This constructor only creates the object. Its full initialization is deferred until its start method is called.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(LbmCt inCt,
                  java.lang.String topicStr,
                  com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMReceiverAttributes rcvAttr,
                  com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMReceiverCallback rcvCb,
                  LbmCtRcvConnCreateCallback connCreateCb,
                  LbmCtRcvConnDeleteCallback connDeleteCb,
                  java.lang.Object cbArg)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Initilaizes a CT Receiver object. This is typically called immediately after the object is created (LbmCtRcv() constructor). The start method can return before any connections are made.

        When the application is finished using this CT Receiver, it should be stopped (stop() API).

        Parameters:
        inCt - CT object to associate with this CT Source.
        topicStr - Topic string. This is the same as the symbol parameter when looking up a UM receiver topic object with LBMTopic.
        rcvAttr - Attributes object used to configure the underlying UM receiver. This is the same as the lbmrattr parameter when looking up a UM receiver topic object with LBMTopic.
        rcvCb - An object implementing the LBMReceiverCallback interface. This is the same as the cb parameter when creating a UM receiver with LBMReceiver. It is used to deliver messages and other receiver-related events to the application. Note that the LBM_BOS and LBM_EOS events are filtered out and are not delivered to the application. The CT connection create and delete callbacks should be used instead.
        connCreateCb - Callback object invoked when a CT source connects to this CT receiver. Technically this parameter is optional (null should be passed if not needed), but its use is central to the Connected Topics paradigm.
        connDeleteCb - Callback object invoked when a CT source disconnects from this CT receiver. Technically this parameter is optional (null should be passed if not needed), but its use is central to the Connected Topics paradigm.
        cbArg - Application-specific object to be associated with the connected receiver, which is passed to the three callbacks (rcvCb, connCreateCb, and connDeleteCb). Note that the CT Receiver maintains a reference to the cbArg object until the CT Receiver is stopped. This parameter is optional (null should be passed if not needed).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - LBMException thrown.

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Stops this CT receiver object. Calling this method performs a graceful disconnection of any active connections, blocking the caller until the disconnections are completed.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - LBMException thrown.
